intro: Diaphananthe producta, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Diaphananthe producta is well-suited to moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
